title: A Holiday Tour in Europe. Described in a series of letters written for The Public Ledger, etc
author: Cook, Joel.
snippet: It would be impossible to write of or remember, in a hastyvisit, all the attractions of this wonderful city. It has amagnificent drive around Arthur's Seat, known as the Queen'sDrive, from which there are a series of lovely views acrossthe Firth of Forth to Fifeshire, and over the land towards thePentland Hills, disclosing a beautiful country. Up near thetop of this hill is a pretty little lake, whereof it is told that abefogged guide, on one occasion, informed some strangers thatthe Ark, after the deluge, rested on Arthur's Seat, and thislake was a " piece of the flood."
